member.name: T:Forge.Utilities.AtomicActivation
member.summary: Thread-safe activation trigger that only activates once.
member.remarks: In a sense, this is equivalent to extending Interlocked to operate on booleans.

member.name: F:Forge.Utilities.AtomicActivation.ACTIVATED
member.summary: An activated activation state

member.name: F:Forge.Utilities.AtomicActivation.UNACTIVATED
member.summary: A deactivated activation state.

member.name: F:Forge.Utilities.AtomicActivation._activated
member.summary: Have we been activated?

member.name: M:Forge.Utilities.AtomicActivation.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the AtomicActivation class in an unactivated state.

member.name: M:Forge.Utilities.AtomicActivation.Reset
member.summary: Resets the activation state, so that Activate() will return true on then next call.

member.name: M:Forge.Utilities.AtomicActivation.TryActivate
member.summary: Returns true if the activation state was previously unactivated.
member.returns: True if the activation activated for this call

member.name: P:Forge.Utilities.AtomicActivation.IsActivated
member.summary: Returns true if the current activation state is activated.

member.name: M:Forge.Utilities.Bound.Intersects(Forge.Utilities.Bound)
member.summary: Returns true if this bound is either intersecting or colliding with the other bound.

member.name: M:Forge.Utilities.Bound.Contains(Forge.Utilities.Vector2r)
member.summary: Returns true if the given point is contained within this bound.

member.name: M:Forge.Utilities.Bound.Contains(Forge.Utilities.Real,Forge.Utilities.Real)
member.summary: Returns true if the given point is contained within this bound.

member.name: T:Forge.Utilities.FastStringFormat
member.summary: Provides methods which format a string without garbage allocation.
member.remarks: The format strings only go from {0} to {9} and do not support any customizations. Backslashes are also not supported.

member.name: M:Forge.Utilities.RandomExtensionMethods.NextLong(System.Random,System.Int64,System.Int64)
member.summary: Returns a random long from min (inclusive) to max (exclusive)
member.param: The given random instance
The inclusive minimum bound
The exclusive maximum bound. Must be greater than min

member.name: M:Forge.Utilities.RandomExtensionMethods.NextLong(System.Random,System.Int64)
member.summary: Returns a random long from 0 (inclusive) to max (exclusive)
member.param: The given random instance
The exclusive maximum bound. Must be greater than 0

member.name: M:Forge.Utilities.RandomExtensionMethods.NextLong(System.Random)
member.summary: Returns a random long over all possible values of long (except long.MaxValue, similar to random.Next())
member.param: The given random instance

member.summary: Helper for Maybe[T] by providing local type inference at Just and Empty call sites.

member.summary: Returns a new Maybe instance containing the given value.

member.summary: Returns a maybe instance that is empty.
member.typeparam: The type of the maybe instance.

member.name: T:Forge.Utilities.MaybeExtensions
member.summary: Some common extensions for the maybe class.

member.name: M:Forge.Utilities.MaybeExtensions.Lift``2(Forge.Utilities.Maybe{``0},System.Func{``0,Forge.Utilities.Maybe{``1}})
member.summary: Lifts a maybe into another maybe using the given lifting function. If the given maybe is empty, then an empty maybe is returned.
member.typeparam: The type of the original maybe
The type of the new maybe
member.param: The maybe to transform
The lifting function that will transform the maybe
member.returns: A new maybe created by the lifting function

member.name: M:Forge.Utilities.MaybeExtensions.Lift``2(Forge.Utilities.Maybe{``0},System.Func{``0,``1})
member.summary: Lifts a maybe into another maybe using the given lifting function. If the given maybe is empty, then an empty maybe is returned.The returned maybe is never empty.
member.typeparam: The type of the original maybe
The type of the new maybe
member.param: The maybe to transform
The lifting function that will transform the maybe
member.returns: A new maybe created by the lifting function

member.name: M:Forge.Utilities.MaybeExtensions.Lift``2(Forge.Utilities.Maybe{``0})
member.summary: C# has a limitation where non-reference generic types cannot be contravariant (the Maybe generic type should be contravariant). This function eases that limitation by providing automatic casting to a higher Maybe type.

member.name: T:Forge.Utilities.Maybe`1
member.summary: Maybe wraps another type and is used to signal to other code that it might not return a result. It performs the same function as null, but in a more type-safe manner that provides more clarity into the contract that function exhibits.
member.typeparam: The type of value stored in the Maybe instance

member.name: F:Forge.Utilities.Maybe`1._value
member.summary: The stored value in the maybe instance. Only contains interesting data if _hasValue is true (otherwise the data is garbage).

member.name: F:Forge.Utilities.Maybe`1._hasValue
member.summary: True if the maybe instance is currently holding a value.

member.name: M:Forge.Utilities.Maybe`1.#ctor(`0)
member.summary: Creates a new Maybe container that holds the given value.

member.name: M:Forge.Utilities.Maybe`1.#ctor(`0,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Internal constructor used to construct the maybe. Used primarily in construction of the Empty element.

member.name: F:Forge.Utilities.Maybe`1.Empty
member.summary: Default empty instance.

member.name: P:Forge.Utilities.Maybe`1.Value
member.summary: Gets the underlying value.
member.remarks: If IsEmpty returns true, then this method will throw an InvalidOperationException.

member.name: P:Forge.Utilities.Maybe`1.Exists
member.summary: Returns true if this Maybe has a value stored in it.

member.name: P:Forge.Utilities.Maybe`1.IsEmpty
member.summary: Returns true if this Maybe is empty, it, it does not have a value stored in it.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.summary: Resets this notifier so that it will notify listeners again.

member.name: M:Forge.Utilities.Notifier`1.Notify
member.summary: Notify the listeners if they have not already been notified.

member.name: E:Forge.Utilities.Notifier`1.Listener
member.summary: Allows objects to listen for notifications. If the notifier has already been triggered, then the added listener is immediately called.

member.name: T:Forge.Utilities.PropertyMetadata
member.summary: A PropertyMetadata describes a discovered property or field in a TypeMetadata.

member.summary: The cached name of the property/field.

member.summary: Writes a value to the property that this property metadata represents, using given object instance as the context.

member.summary: Reads a value from the property that this property metadata represents, using the given object instance as the context.

member.name: F:Forge.Utilities.PropertyMetadata.StorageType
member.summary: The type of value that is stored inside of the property. For example, for an int field, StorageType will be typeof(int).

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the PropertyMetadata class from a property member.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the PropertyMetadata class from a field member.

member.summary: Determines whether the specified object is equal to this one.

member.summary: Determines whether the specified object is equal to this one.

member.name: M:Forge.Utilities.PropertyMetadata.GetHashCode
member.summary: Returns a hash code for this instance.
member.returns: A hash code for this instance, suitable for use in hashing algorithms and data structures like a hash table.

member.name: P:Forge.Utilities.PropertyMetadata.MemberInfo
member.summary: The member info that we read to and write from.

member.name: T:Forge.Utilities.Real
member.summary: A Real value implements floating point operations on the CPU. It does not adhere any any IEEE standard, but has the extremely important attribute of providing identical semantics on every CPU which executes it. This is otherwise impossible to guarantee in the CLR, especially when 3rd party code is running and/or C++ DLL access is unavailable to set x87 FPU rounding modes.

member.name: M:Forge.Utilities.Real.ShiftDecimal(System.Int32)
member.summary: Assuming this real has a base 10 representation, this shifts the decimal value to the left by count digits.

member.name: M:Forge.Utilities.Real.GetDigitCount(System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns the number of digits in the given value. The negative sign is not considered a digit.

member.name: M:Forge.Utilities.Real.CreateDecimal(System.Int64,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Creates a real value with that is 0.number. For example, CreateDecimal(123) will create a real value that is equal to "0.123".
member.remarks: CreateDecimal(1, 0005, 4) will create 1.0005 CreateDecimal(1, 5, 4) will create 1.0005

member.name: M:Forge.Utilities.Real.FromParts(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Create a fixed-int number from parts. For example, to create 1.5 pass in 1 and 500.
member.param: The number above the decimal. For 1.5, this would be 1.
The number below the decimal, to three digits. For 1.5, this would be 500. For 1.005, this would be 5.
member.returns: A fixed-int representation of the number parts

member.name: T:Forge.Utilities.Real.RealJsonConverter
member.summary: Serializes Real values to JSON and back as floats. Without using a converter, Reals would be serialized as an object ({}) which would create a lot of unnecessary bloat.

member.summary: Container type that holds a reference to another object.
member.typeparam: The type of object to store a reference to.

member.name: T:Forge.Utilities.TypeCache
member.summary: Caches type name to type lookups. Type lookups occur in all loaded assemblies.

member.name: F:Forge.Utilities.TypeCache._cachedTypes
member.summary: Cache from fully qualified type name to type instances.

member.name: F:Forge.Utilities.TypeCache._cachedMetadata
member.summary: Cache from Type to the respective TypeMetadata.

member.name: F:Forge.Utilities.TypeCache._assemblies
member.summary: Assemblies indexed by their name.

member.name: M:Forge.Utilities.TypeCache.TryDirectTypeLookup(System.String,System.String,System.Type@)
member.summary: Does a direct lookup for the given type, ie, goes directly to the assembly identified by assembly name and finds it there.
member.param: The assembly to find the type in.
The name of the type.
The found type.
member.returns: True if the type was found, false otherwise.

member.name: M:Forge.Utilities.TypeCache.TryIndirectTypeLookup(System.String,System.Type@)
member.summary: Tries to do an indirect type lookup by scanning through every loaded assembly until the type is found in one of them.
member.param: The name of the type.
The found type.
member.returns: True if the type was found, false otherwise.

member.name: M:Forge.Utilities.TypeCache.FindType(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Find a type with the given name. An exception is thrown if no type with the given name can be found. This method searches all currently loaded assemblies for the given type.
member.param: The fully qualified name of the type.
A hint for the assembly to start the search with

member.name: M:Forge.Utilities.TypeCache.FindTypeMetadata(System.Type)
member.summary: Finds the associated TypeMetadata for the given type.
member.param: The type to find the type metadata for.
member.returns: A TypeMetadata that models the given type.

member.name: T:Forge.Utilities.TypeExtensions
member.summary: Extensions to the Type API.

member.name: M:Forge.Utilities.TypeExtensions.GetInterface(System.Type,System.Type)
member.summary: Searches for a particular implementation of the given interface type inside of the type. This is particularly useful if the interface type is an open type, ie, typeof(IFace[]), because this method will then return IFace[] but with appropriate type parameters inserted.
member.param: The base type to search for interface
The interface type to search for. Can be an open generic type.
member.returns: The actual interface type that the type contains, or null if there is no implementation of the given interfaceType on type.

member.name: M:Forge.Utilities.TypeExtensions.IsImplementationOf(System.Type,System.Type)
member.summary: Returns true if the baseType is an implementation of the given interface type. The interface type can be generic.
member.param: The type to search for an implementation of the given interface
The interface type to search for

member.name: T:Forge.Utilities.TypeMetadata
member.summary: Provides a view of an arbitrary type that unifies a number of discrete concepts in the CLR. Arrays and Collection types have special support, but their APIs are unified by the TypeMetadata so that they can be treated as if they were a regular type.

member.name: M:Forge.Utilities.TypeMetadata.CreateInstance
member.summary: Creates a new instance of the type that this metadata points back to.
member.remarks: Activator.CreateInstance cannot be used because TypeMetadata can point to an Array.

member.name: M:Forge.Utilities.TypeMetadata.CollectionSizeHint(System.Object@,System.Int32)
member.summary: Hint that there will be size number of elements stored in the given collection. This method is completely optional, but if the collection is an array then it will improve the performance of AppendValue.
member.param: The collection type.
The size hint to use for the collection

member.name: M:Forge.Utilities.TypeMetadata.AppendValue(System.Object@,System.Object,System.Int32)
member.summary: Appends a value to the end of the array or collection. If the collection is an array, then the item is added to array[indexHint]. If it is a collection, then the item is just appended to the end of the collection.

member.name: M:Forge.Utilities.TypeMetadata.#ctor(System.Type)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the TypeMetadata class from a type. Use TypeCache to get instances of TypeMetadata; do not use this constructor directly.

member.name: M:Forge.Utilities.TypeMetadata.CollectProperties(System.Type,System.Collections.Generic.HashSet{Forge.Utilities.PropertyMetadata})
member.summary: Recursive method that adds all of the properties and fields from the given type into the given list. This method also fetches inherited properties by using the TypeCache to retrieve the TypeMetadata for the parent type.
member.param: The type to process to collect properties from.
The list of properties that should be appended to

member.name: F:Forge.Utilities.TypeMetadata._collectionAddMethod
member.summary: The cached Add method in ICollection[T]. This only contains a value if IsCollection is true.

member.name: F:Forge.Utilities.TypeMetadata._isArray
member.summary: True if the base type is an array. If true, accessing Properties will throw an exception. IsCollection is also true if _isArray is true.

member.name: M:Forge.Utilities.TypeMetadata.RemoveProperty(System.String)
member.summary: Attempts to remove the property with the given name.
member.param: The name of the property to remove.
member.returns: True if the property was removed, false if it was not found.

member.name: P:Forge.Utilities.TypeMetadata.ReflectedType
member.summary: The type that this metadata is modeling, ie, the type that the metadata was constructed off of.

member.name: P:Forge.Utilities.TypeMetadata.ElementType
member.summary: Iff this metadata maps back to a Collection or an Array type, then this is the type of element stored inside the array or collection. Otherwise, this method throws an exception.

member.name: P:Forge.Utilities.TypeMetadata.IsCollection
member.summary: True if the base type is a collection. If true, accessing Properties will throw an exception.

member.name: P:Forge.Utilities.TypeMetadata.Properties
member.summary: The properties on the type. This is used when importing/exporting a type that does not have a user-defined importer/exporter.

member.name: F:Forge.Utilities.UniqueIntGenerator._next
member.summary: The next integer to generate.

member.name: M:Forge.Utilities.UniqueIntGenerator.Next
member.summary: Returns the next unique int.

member.name: M:Forge.Utilities.UniqueIntGenerator.Consume(System.Int32)
member.summary: Notifies that UniqueIdGenerator that the given ID has already been consumed. Please note that this API is not thread-safe.
